title: Kevin Hart crash driver Jared Black is back behind the wheel after horrific collision in Malibu
text:
He's driving again after a horrific collision over Labor Day weekend in Malibu.

And Jared Black looked at ease as he sat in the driver's seat of a smokey grey Land Rover with fiancee Rebecca Broxterman riding shotgun in Los Angeles on Thursday afternoon.

Jared was airlifted to a local hospital on the morning of Sept. 1 after driving Kevin Hart's vintage Plymouth down an embankment, where both men required major surgeries after suffering back injuries from the terrifying crash.

Out and about: Jared Black looked at ease as he sat in the driver's seat of a smokey grey Land Rover with fiancee Rebecca Broxterman riding shotgun in Los Angeles on Thursday afternoon

Jared and his fiancee were spotted driving around town in a sporty SUV nearly one month after the crash.

Authorities relayed to TMZ that Jared 'suffered chest injuries' after slamming into the steering wheel when the Plymouth finally landed down a dirt hill off of Mulholland Highway.

The California Highway Patrol recently deemed Black 'at fault' for the collision because he was 'recklessly driving the vehicle' before it crashed.

They also determined that he 'gunned the 720 horsepower engine and lost control' of the car, where his fiancee was sitting in the backseat.

Law enforcement officials also revealed that 'none of the three people in the car were wearing seat belts.'

After stripping down Hart's vintage car, authorities found it 'did not have any mechanical issues' and that the crash was caused by 'driver error.'

Kevin had to have his spine fused back together after breaking it in three places following the smash.

Despite the terrible scene, Kevin expressed 'nothing but love' for the couple in his first statement since checking out of an in-patient rehab facility.

'I have nothing but love for Jared and wish him and Rebecca a speedy recovery,' he said in a statement released through his attorney on Thursday.
